reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used HH points for our stay at the Hampton Inn in Cambridge. This hotel is across the street from the T, so it is very convenient to getting in and out of Boston. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and large. The bed was very comfortable. It was a great value because it included breakfast and did not charge for parking. The only reason I did not give it the higest grade, was because their guest computer was not working, and therefore was not available for us to use.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our way to Cape Cod by motorcycle we had planned an overnight stay in Cambridge. Of course, as luck would have it, heavy rain started coming down just as we got off I-95 and headed into Cambridge's unfamiliar streets to try and find the Hampton Inn. After a few wrong turns we finally got there, a bit soaked, but no worse for wear. I must've been quite a sight walking into the lobby with my big bulky motorcycle suit dripping water all over the floor, because as soon as the guy working at the front desk saw me, he smiled and we both had a bit of a chuckle. We were a bit early (maybe two hours before check-in), but he shuffled a few rooms and got us something right away so that we could change into something dry! They even saved us a spot in the underground parking right next to the elevator so that we could unload the bike without having to walk too far. The room was very nice, with a bed so comfortable that I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud. As with other Hampton Inns, the breakfast buffet is one of the best there is. Another plus is that it's only a few steps from the T station, which is a cheap way to get into the city and ramble around.
reviews.title: Great, Helpful Staff

likes.disliked: — View from back rooms is just ho-hum...

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for two nights in early April. Hotel was much more than I expected. Very clean and orderly. The complimentary breakfast was great; eggs, french toast, sausage, and many other breakfast foods. The rooms were recently upgraded. New, more comfortable beds, down or down alternative comforters, duvets, and new bathroom amenities. Free parking garage that is very safe. A short drive to downtown Boston. Overall, it was a great stay!!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Boston before and stayed downtown: what a mistake! Rooms are overpriced and parking inexistant!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: That's why I stayed in Cambridge this time. This hotel is really a great deal if you plan to visit Boston. It is conviniently located to the T station (Leachmere) that go directly downtown in about 10 minutes. The rooms are nice and big and full of little attentions that make the stay more enjoyable (Two type of pillows, free Internet in the lobby). The continental breakfast is the best I ever had in this type of hotel, there was plenty of options, hot and cold. The staff is friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Safe & Convenient

reviews.text: My sister and I went to Boston for a small vacation while driving up from New Jersey. I found the Hampton Inn extremely affordable compared to other hotels in the area. We didn't really know the area so we wanted to be close to the T system, which turned out to be extremely accessible right across the street. The woman was very helpful with our tickets gave us the exact amount it would take us to go to each of our destinations. The front desk was very polite and we experienced a very fast check in. We had a room with 2 queen beds, not much of a view but the beds were very comfortable. Reminded me of home. We could hear the tv in the next room but only for a little bit before they turned it down. The next morning we had a complimentary breakfast which had hot/cold food. The best part of all is the free parking at the hotel that can run you as much as 40 dollars a day at other places. Overall i recommend this hotel and plan to stay there in the future.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We arrived in Boston after dark so the hotel was a little difficult to find in the dark.
reviews.title: Great Stay as usual!

reviews.text: We continue to book this hotel for our Boston stays because of it's rates, location and free parking. The Green line is less than block away to put you within minutes of the city. Located within walking distance to the Museum of Science and the CambridgeSide Galleria Mall.
reviews.title: The only thing it's missing is a bar and restaurant..

likes.liked: — Value for money, located close to the green tube line and bus station.

reviews.text: The rooms are average size for the Boston area. The new beds are a great addition and very comfy.
reviews.title: Great Value Across the Charles River from Boston

likes.disliked: — One of the elevators was not working

reviews.text: The hotel offers a great complimentary continental breakfast with all that we ever eat.
reviews.title: Best Hampton Inn I have ever stayed in!

reviews.text: Found out about this hotel through Tripadvisor. We went to the Red Sox game this past weekend and this place was just what we were looking for. Clean room, secure parking in a closed garage, walking distance to the Lechmere T Station and decent breakfast in the AM. Just stayed here one night, but will recommend this to friends if back in town again. Stayed on a Sat. night, made my reservation the night before and paid about $209/night + tax. Not the cheapest, but considering the La Quinta in Somerville and the Holiday Inn Express down the street were both $250+ that night, not a bad deal on short notice. Hotel staff was friendly. Only at $9 cab ride from Fenway Park back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient To Downtown Boston

likes.liked: — Convenient Hotel to Downtown Boston, Less $$$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second time staying at the Hampton Inn in East Cambridge and I love it! The price is right and its so close to the city.
reviews.title: Can't Beat the Location and Quality!

likes.disliked: — Its still a bit expensive, but that's Boston for you!

reviews.text: The hotel is a 2-3 minute walk to the T, which will take you anywhere in Boston. East Cambridge is very close to the city. I took a cab from Fanueil Hall one night, which only set me back $8. Although East Cambridge isn't the prettiest location, its still comes in handy. It is within walking distance to a shopping center and a major mall -- The Cambridgeside Galleria. We had dinner here when we arrived exhausted from our flight and also picked up some last minute items at CVS.
reviews.title: True to Hampton Inn's brand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice---big, comfy beds---we had a king plus a desk and small loveseat. Free Internet access in the room, which we took advantage of. There is also a computer with printer in the lobby---great for printing boarding passes!
reviews.title: great deal, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free breakfast was pretty good with hot selections in addition to the other usual stuff (bagels, yogurt, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, etc.). The first day we had waffles and sausage. The next day fried eggs and sausage were served, which we made into sandwiches on biscuits. Yum!
reviews.title: Affordable and welcoming

likes.liked: — Full breakfast - affordability - location to the T and Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while visiting Boston for the first time. The location was very convenient - within walking distance to several areas and right down the block from the subway station. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in. The room was bright and well appointed. The free parking and free use of their computer and printer added to the value.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Check-in and check-out were flawless. No noise problems. Breakfast was adequate. Coffee was great.
reviews.title: Good spot, close to Boston

reviews.text: We stayed here one night for a quick trip to Boston. Check in was good, clerk as friendly. There is free on-site parking. They let us stay a little longer after check-out so we could go into Boston. It's close to the subway stop, about one block.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Stay

reviews.text: The room was good, with adequate climate control. The bathroom could have used a little sprucing up around the mirror but it was clean. bed was comfortable and firm, towels were OK.
reviews.title: Loved My Stay
Good, but pricey
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was normal for a Hampton Inn, nothing special but it's no extra charge.
